alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 12:26AM CDT until August 05 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR CLARK AND SOUTHERN SCOTLAND COUNTIES... At 1226 AM CDT, Local law enforcement reported torrential rain across the warned area with at least one road washed out near Bible Grove. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kahoka, Memphis, Warsaw, Wayland, Wyaconda, Alexandria, Rutledge, Luray, South Gorin, Granger, St. Francisville, Crawford, Winchester, Arbela, Fairmont, Etna, Neeper, Ashton and Medill. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
